_header: With their temptations features and fashion
_description: On the temptation of ?an Irish divine? — ten lines in rhyme royal

DublinRepBlack.First Lines:
…With ther temptacions fetures and facionMowthes of flamyng
                    fyre furyous to seeCame hyme to hys holy intencyon To dissolue and
                    seperat fro þe deyteThey made hym so masyde and abusyde to beThat
                    hys wytte and welfare was myswentAs he had newyr bene man vndyr the
                    predyament…
DublinRepBlack.Last Lines:
…Wyth sound and noyse of þis bellis pulsacion Was herd
                    and noysyd throghoute all Irland Of the inhabytauntys therin of euery
                    nacyon…
DublinRepBlack.Note: Fragment, incomplete at beginning and end.
